title: Folder Panel hidden, how to display it
content:

title: Folders/subfolders
content: I have folders and subfolders set up to keep emails organized. Here lately if I set up a folder or subfolder and move a read email to that folder, later the folder shows up as "Light grey" and the contents are gone. I don't have a clue what is happening.
creator: davidraymond

title: Thunderbird
content: With this latest version of Thunderbird my incoming emails are showing code data and text, yet the previous versions never displayed code data in the messages. Just today an incoming email from a regular addressee could not show text because Thunderbird said the client does not use HTML. How do I solve the problem, I am not interested in or understand code data
creator: Ian47

creator: cfl52473

title: Thunderbird Emails Not Showing Up
content:
Hi,

Just installed Windows 11.

Now, none of my email accounts (all Gmail) are showing up in any of the folders. I have deleted the 'global-message-do.SQLite' and *.msf' files and restarted, still to no avail.

Not that I expected much, but a reinstall of Thunderbird, didnt help either. I dont think removing the accounts and reconnecting will do anything either. I can see the emails downloading again, and new emails are coming in, but I can not see the new or old emails.

Any ideas?

Cheers.
creator: kmonroe.morgan

title: Thunderbird receives but will NOT send messages
content:
I have used Thunderbird for several years but it has recently stopped being able to SEND a message. When ever I attempt to do so, when I click SEND it pops up the usual message box "Sending Message" followed by the Subject text. This box remains on the screen for some minutes and then it sounds an alert and is replaced with a message box "Send Message Error" with the message "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtpauth.earthlink.net timed out. Try again." There have been NO changes to the specs for sending or receiving with Earthlink that I am aware of.

I still receive messages on Thunderbird just fine and can both send and receive message on Google's email client with Earthlink just fine with no recent change its specs.

Please HELP!

Bud Crain
creator: dumbowsky
